reasoning: FASD is a spectrum of conditions resulting from prenatal alcohol exposure. Reporting both incidence (~1.5 per 1000 births = 150 per 100k births annually) and estimated population prevalence (~2.5% of population). CDC 2004 estimates suggest 0.5-1.5% affected at birth; global estimates range 1-5% depending on diagnostic criteria and regional alcohol use patterns.
source: Sampson PD et al. (2007). Incidence of fetal alcohol syndrome and prevalence of alcohol-related neurodevelopmental disorder. Teratology. 56(5):317-326; CDC estimates (2004)
